issues.description: The UML in the problem statement declares getTotalNumberOfStudents() as returning a String (problem_statement.md line 70), while the solution implementation defines getTotalNumberOfStudents() to return an int (solution_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Lecture.java). The template also points students to implement this method (template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Lecture.java TODO 2.4). This mismatch between the UML (and the hint that students should check the UML for the expected return type) and the solution/template will likely confuse students about which return type to implement and can lead to compilation/test failures.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the return type consistent across the problem statement, template, and solution. Preferred fix: update the UML and any textual descriptions in problem_statement.md to declare getTotalNumberOfStudents(): int (and update the hint to reflect an int return). Alternatively, if the intent was to return a String, change the solution implementation to return a String representation. Ensure tests and examples match the chosen type.
